text: This may be naive but besides large executable sizes, can't Julia perform equally as well in the systems software realm as C and Rust if you disable GC and manage memory manually?

elements.text: This may be naive but besides large executable sizes, can't Julia perform equally as well in the systems software realm as C and Rust if you disable GC and manage memory manually?

text: you'll also have a higher minimum ram usage since the julia runtime will be in memory

elements.text: you'll also have a higher minimum ram usage since the julia runtime will be in memory

text: Whats the minimum RAM of C compared with Julia (is it just the file size of the executables with some slight overhead?)? Is there a way to lower Julias RAM consumption (without compromising on performance)?
